title: FF! Doc | AmqpSender
paragraphs:
When a message is to be received as a streaming message by the recipient, it has to be sent as a MessageType.BINARY message.
When setStreamingMessages is configured
listItems: AUTO Automatically determine the type of the outgoing org.apache.qpid.protonj2.client.Message based on the value of Message.isBinary().
TEXT Create the outgoing message with an AmqpValue section containing character data.
BINARY Create the outgoing message with an AMQP Body section containing the message as binary data. Only binary messages can be read or created in a streaming manner when messages are large.

Syntax
Copy

Attributes
Required
ATTRIBUTE NAME & DESCRIPTION	TYPE	DEFAULT
connectionName	text	-
Name of the AMQP connection in the amqp section of the resources.yaml file.
address	text	-
Set the address (name of the queue or topic) on which to send messages.
Optional
ATTRIBUTE NAME & DESCRIPTION	TYPE	DEFAULT
timeout	number	30
Timeout in seconds for sending messages and receiving replies.
addressType	options	QUEUE
Set the type of address to which messages are being sent, TOPIC or QUEUE. For MessageProtocol#RR the type will always be QUEUE.
Available Options: TOPIC, QUEUE
messageType	options	AUTO
Set the message type: MessageType.TEXT to character
